books.author: by David Grann
books.description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil.
books.name: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON

books.author: by Daniel James Brown
books.description: The story of the American rowers who pursued gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympic Games; the basis of the film.
books.name: THE BOYS IN THE BOAT

books.author: by Liz Cheney
books.description: The former congresswoman from Wyoming recounts how she helped lead the Select Committee to Investigate the Jan. 6. Attack on the United States Capitol.
books.name: OATH AND HONOR

books.author: by David Grann
books.description: The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events.
books.name: THE WAGER

books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.
books.name: OUTLIVE

books.author: by Tim Alberta
books.description: The author of “American Carnage” looks at divisions within the American evangelical movement.
books.name: THE KINGDOM, THE POWER, AND THE GLORY

books.author: by Britney Spears
books.description: The Grammy Award-winning pop star details her personal and professional experiences, including the years she spent under a conservatorship overseen by her father.
books.name: THE WOMAN IN ME

books.author: by Adam Grant
books.description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.
books.name: THINK AGAIN

books.author: by Walter Isaacson
books.description: The author of “The Code Breaker” traces Musk’s life and summarizes his work on electric vehicles, private space exploration and artificial intelligence.
books.name: ELON MUSK

books.author: by Molly Roden Winter
books.description: A couple with small children choose to have an open marriage.
books.name: MORE

books.author: by Matthew Perry
books.description: The late actor, known for playing Chandler Bing on “Friends,” shares stories from his childhood and his struggles with sobriety.
books.name: FRIENDS, LOVERS, AND THE BIG TERRIBLE THING

books.author: by Dolly Alderton
books.description: The British journalist shares stories and observations; the basis of the TV series.
books.name: EVERYTHING I KNOW ABOUT LOVE

books.author: by Michele Norris
books.description: Stories, essays and photographs exploring race and identity in America.
books.name: OUR HIDDEN CONVERSATIONS

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.
books.name: CASTE
